value.name: Hawkeye
value.overview: Former Avenger Clint Barton has a seemingly simple mission: get back to his family for Christmas. Possible? Maybe with the help of Kate Bishop, a 22-year-old archer with dreams of becoming a superhero. The two are forced to work together when a presence from Barton’s past threatens to derail far more than the festive spirit.

value.name: Never Meet Your Heroes
value.overview: Archer Kate Bishop lands in the middle of a criminal conspiracy, forcing Hawkeye out of retirement.

value.name: Hide and Seek
value.overview: Clint has to help Kate disentangle herself from the Tracksuit mafia and a real-life murder mystery.

value.name: Echoes
value.overview: After narrowly escaping the Tracksuits and their daunting leader Maya Lopez, Clint and Kate work together to find answers. With each step they take, however, they find themselves sliding deeper into a rapidly growing criminal conspiracy.

value.name: Game of Thrones
value.overview: Seven noble families fight for control of the mythical land of Westeros. Friction between the houses leads to full-scale war. All while a very ancient evil awakens in the farthest north. Amidst the war, a neglected military order of misfits, the Night's Watch, is all that stands between the realms of men and icy horrors beyond.

value.name: Season 1
value.overview: Trouble is brewing in the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros. For the driven inhabitants of this visionary world, control of Westeros' Iron Throne holds the lure of great power. But in a land where the seasons can last a lifetime, winter is coming...and beyond the Great Wall that protects them, an ancient evil has returned. In Season One, the story centers on three primary areas: the Stark and the Lannister families, whose designs on controlling the throne threaten a tenuous peace; the dragon princess Daenerys, heir to the former dynasty, who waits just over the Narrow Sea with her malevolent brother Viserys; and the Great Wall--a massive barrier of ice where a forgotten danger is stirring.

value.name: Winter Is Coming
value.overview: Jon Arryn, the Hand of the King, is dead. King Robert Baratheon plans to ask his oldest friend, Eddard Stark, to take Jon's place. Across the sea, Viserys Targaryen plans to wed his sister to a nomadic warlord in exchange for an army.

value.name: The Kingsroad
value.overview: While Bran recovers from his fall, Ned takes only his daughters to Kings Landing. Jon Snow goes with his uncle Benjen to The Wall. Tyrion joins them.

value.name: Lord Snow
value.overview: Lord Stark and his daughters arrive at King's Landing to discover the intrigues of the king's realm.

value.name: Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things
value.overview: Eddard investigates Jon Arryn's murder. Jon befriends Samwell Tarly, a coward who has come to join the Night's Watch.

value.name: The Wolf and the Lion
value.overview: Catelyn has captured Tyrion and plans to bring him to her sister, Lysa Arryn, at The Vale, to be tried for his, supposed, crimes against Bran. Robert plans to have Daenerys killed, but Eddard refuses to be a part of it and quits.

value.name: A Golden Crown
value.overview: While recovering from his battle with Jamie, Eddard is forced to run the kingdom while Robert goes hunting. Tyrion demands a trial by combat for his freedom. Viserys is losing his patience with Drogo.

value.name: You Win or You Die
value.overview: Robert has been injured while hunting and is dying. Jon and the others finally take their vows to the Night's Watch. A man, sent by Robert, is captured for trying to poison Daenerys. Furious, Drogo vows to attack the Seven Kingdoms.

value.name: The Pointy End
value.overview: Eddard and his men are betrayed and captured by the Lannisters. When word reaches Robb, he plans to go to war to rescue them. The White Walkers attack The Wall. Tyrion returns to his father with some new friends.

value.name: Baelor
value.overview: Robb goes to war against the Lannisters. Jon finds himself struggling on deciding if his place is with Robb or the Night's Watch. Drogo has fallen ill from a fresh battle wound. Daenerys is desperate to save him.

value.name: Fire and Blood
value.overview: With Ned dead, Robb vows to get revenge on the Lannisters. Jon must officially decide if his place is with Robb or the Night's Watch. Daenerys says her final goodbye to Drogo.

value.name: Season 2
value.overview: The cold winds of winter are rising in Westeros...war is coming...and five kings continue their savage quest for control of the all-powerful Iron Throne. With winter fast approaching, the coveted Iron Throne is occupied by the cruel Joffrey, counseled by his conniving mother Cersei and uncle Tyrion. But the Lannister hold on the Throne is under assault on many fronts. Meanwhile, a new leader is rising among the wildings outside the Great Wall, adding new perils for Jon Snow and the order of the Night's Watch.

value.name: The North Remembers
value.overview: As Robb Stark and his northern army continue the war against the Lannisters, Tyrion arrives in King’s Landing to counsel Joffrey and temper the young king’s excesses.  On the island of Dragonstone, Stannis Baratheon plots an invasion to claim his late brother’s throne, allying himself with the fiery Melisandre, a strange priestess of a stranger god.  Across the sea, Daenerys, her three young dragons, and the khalasar trek through the Red Waste in search of allies, or water.  In the North, Bran presides over a threadbare Winterfell, while beyond the Wall, Jon Snow and the Night’s Watch must shelter with a devious wildling.

value.name: The Night Lands
value.overview: In the wake of a bloody purge in the capital, Tyrion chastens Cersei for alienating the king’s subjects.  On the road north, Arya shares a secret with Gendry, a Night’s Watch recruit.  With supplies dwindling, one of Dany’s scouts returns with news of their position.  After nine years as a Stark ward, Theon Greyjoy reunites with his father Balon, who wants to restore the ancient Kingdom of the Iron Islands.  Davos enlists Salladhor Saan, a pirate, to join forces with Stannis and Melisandre for a naval invasion of King’s Landing.

value.name: What is Dead May Never Die
value.overview: At the Red Keep, Tyrion plots three alliances through the promise of marriage.  Catelyn arrives in the Stormlands to forge an alliance of her own, but King Renly, his new wife Margaery, and her brother Loras Tyrell have other plans.  At Winterfell, Luwin tries to decipher Bran’s dreams.

value.name: Garden of Bones
value.overview: Joffrey punishes Sansa for Robb’s victories, and Tyrion scrambles to temper the king’s cruelty. Catelyn entreats Stannis and Renly to unite against the Lannisters. Dany and her khalasar arrive at the prosperous city of Qarth. Tyrion coerces a relative into being his eyes and ears. Arya and Gendry are taken to Harrenhal, where their lives are in the hands of Ser Gregor Clegane. Stannis orders Davos to smuggle Melisandre into a secret cove.

value.name: The Ghost of Harrenhal
value.overview: The Baratheon rivalry ends, driving Catelyn to flee and Littlefinger to act. At King’s Landing, Tyrion’s source alerts him to Joffrey’s defense plan - and a mysterious secret weapon. Theon sails to the Stony Shore to prove he’s worthy to be called Ironborn. At Harrenhal, Arya receives a promise from Jaqen H’ghar, one of the prisoners she saved from the Gold Cloaks. The Night’s Watch arrive at the Fist of the First Men, an ancient ringfort where they hope to stem the wildings' advance.

value.name: The Old Gods and the New
value.overview: Theon completes his master stroke. In King's Landing, the Lannisters send Myrcella off to be married. Arya comes face to face with a surprise visitor. Dany vows to take what is hers. Robb and Catelyn receive crucial news. Qhorin gives Jon a chance to prove himself.

value.name: A Man Without Honor
value.overview: Jamie meets a distant relative. Daenerys receives an invitation to the House of the Undying. Theon leads a search party. Jon loses his way in the wilderness. Cersei counsels Sansa.

value.name: The Prince of Winterfell
value.overview: Theon receives a visitor. Arya asks her third and last death from Jaqen. While Stannis' army is reaching its destination, Davos is offered a reward.  Betrayal befalls Robb.

value.name: Blackwater
value.overview: Tyrion and the Lannisters fight for their lives as Stannis’ fleet assaults King’s Landing.

value.name: Valar Morghulis
value.overview: Tyrion awakens to a changed situation. King Joffrey doles out rewards to his subjects. As Theon stirs his men to action, Luwin offers some final advice. Brienne silences Jaime. Arya receives a gift from Jaqen. Dany goes to a strange place. Jon proves himself to Qhorin.

value.name: Season 3
value.overview: Duplicity and treachery...nobility and honor...conquest and triumph...and, of course, dragons. In Season 3, family and loyalty are the overarching themes as many critical storylines from the first two seasons come to a brutal head. Meanwhile, the Lannisters maintain their hold on King's Landing, though stirrings in the North threaten to alter the balance of power; Robb Stark, King of the North, faces a major calamity as he tries to build on his victories; a massive army of wildlings led by Mance Rayder march for the Wall; and Daenerys Targaryen--reunited with her dragons--attempts to raise an army in her quest for the Iron Throne.

value.name: Valar Dohaeris
value.overview: Jon meets the King-Beyond-the-Wall while his Night Watch Brothers flee south. In King's Landing, Tyrion wants a reward, Margaery shows her charitable nature, Cersei arranges a dinner party, and Littlefinger offers to help Sansa. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys starts her journey west.

value.name: Dark Wings, Dark Words
value.overview: Sansa says too much. Shae asks Tyrion for a favor. Jaime finds a way to pass the time, while Arya encounters the Brotherhood Without Banners.

value.name: Walk of Punishment
value.overview: Tyrion shoulders new responsibilities. Jon is taken to the Fist of the First Men. Daenerys meets with the slavers. Jaime strikes a deal with his captors.

value.name: And Now His Watch Is Ended
value.overview: Trouble brews among the Night's Watch at Craster's. Margaery takes Joffrey out of his comfort zone. Arya meets the leader of the Brotherhood. Varys plots revenge on an old foe. Theon mournfully recalls his missteps. Daenerys deftly orchestrates her exit from Astapor.

value.name: Kissed by Fire
value.overview: The Hound is judged by the gods. Jaime is judged by men. Jon proves himself. Robb is betrayed. Tyrion learns the cost of weddings.

value.name: The Climb
value.overview: Tywin plans strategic unions for the Lannisters. Melisandre pays a visit to the Riverlands. Robb weighs a compromise to repair his alliance with House Frey. Roose Bolton decides what to do with Jaime Lannister. Jon, Ygritte, and the Wildlings face a daunting climb.

value.name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
value.overview: Daenerys exchanges gifts with a slave lord outside of Yunkai. As Sansa frets about her prospects, Shae chafes at Tyrion’s new situation. Tywin counsels the king, and Melisandre reveals a secret to Gendry. Brienne faces a formidable foe in Harrenhal.

value.name: Second Sons
value.overview: King’s Landing hosts a wedding, and Tyrion and Sansa spend the night together. Daenerys meets the Titan’s Bastard. Davos demands proof from Melisandre. Sam and Gilly meet an older gentleman.

value.name: The Rains of Castamere
value.overview: Robb presents himself to Walder Frey, and Edmure meets his bride. Jon faces his harshest test yet. Bran discovers a new gift. Daario and Jorah debate how to take Yunkai. House Frey joins with House Tully.

value.name: Mhysa
value.overview: Joffrey challenges Tywin. Bran tells a ghost story. In Dragonstone, mercy comes from strange quarters. Daenerys waits to see if she is a conqueror or a liberator.

value.name: Season 4
value.overview: The War of the Five Kings is drawing to a close, but new intrigues and plots are in motion, and the surviving factions must contend with enemies not only outside their ranks, but within.

value.name: Two Swords
value.overview: Tyrion welcomes a guest to King’s Landing. At Castle Black, Jon Snow finds himself unwelcome. Dany is pointed to Meereen, the mother of all slave cities. Arya runs into an old friend.

value.name: The Lion and the Rose
value.overview: Tyrion lends Jaime a hand. Joffrey and Margaery host a breakfast. At Dragonstone, Stannis loses patience with Davos. Ramsay finds a purpose for his pet. North of the Wall, Bran sees where they must go.

value.name: Breaker of Chains
value.overview: Tyrion ponders his options. Tywin extends an olive branch. Sam realizes Castle Black isn’t safe, and Jon proposes a bold plan. The Hound teaches Arya the way things are. Dany chooses her champion.

value.name: Oathkeeper
value.overview: Dany balances justice and mercy. Jaime tasks Brienne with his honor. Jon secures volunteers while Bran, Jojen, Meera and Hodor stumble on shelter.

value.name: First of His Name
value.overview: Cersei and Tywin plan the Crown's next move; Dany discusses future plans; Jon Snow begins a new mission.

value.name: The Laws of Gods and Men
value.overview: Stannis and Davos set sail; Dany meets with supplicants; Tyrion faces down his father.

value.name: Mockingbird
value.overview: Tyrion gains an unlikely ally; Daario asks Dany to allow him to do what he does best; Jon's warnings about the vulnerability of the Wall are ignored; Brienne follows a new lead.

value.name: The Mountain and the Viper
value.overview: Unexpected visitors arrive in Mole's Town. Littlefinger's motives are questioned. Ramsay tries to prove himself to his father. Tyrion's fate is decided.

value.name: The Watchers on the Wall
value.overview: Jon Snow and the Night's Watch face a big challenge.

value.name: The Children
value.overview: Circumstances change after an unexpected arrival from north of the Wall. Dany must face harsh realities. Bran learns more about his destiny. Tyrion sees the truth about his situation.

value.name: Season 5
value.overview: The War of the Five Kings, once thought to be drawing to a close, is instead entering a new and more chaotic phase. Westeros is on the brink of collapse, and many are seizing what they can while the realm implodes, like a corpse making a feast for crows.

value.name: The Wars to Come
value.overview: Cersei and Jaime adjust to a world without Tywin. Varys reveals a conspiracy to Tyrion. Dany faces a new threat to her rule. Jon is caught between two kings.

value.name: The House of Black and White
value.overview: Arya arrives in Braavos. Podrick and Brienne run into trouble on the road. Cersei fears for her daughter's safety in Dorne as Ellaria Sand seeks revenge for Oberyn's death. Stannis tempts Jon. An adviser tempts Daenerys.

value.name: High Sparrow
value.overview: In Braavos, Arya sees the Many-Faced God. In King's Landing, Queen Margaery enjoys her new husband. Tyrion and Varys walk the Long Bridge of Volantis.

value.name: Sons of the Harpy
value.overview: The Faith Militant grow increasingly aggressive. Jaime and Bronn head south. Ellaria and the Sand Snakes vow vengeance.

value.name: Kill the Boy
value.overview: Dany makes a difficult decision in Meereen. Jon recruits the help of an unexpected ally. Brienne searches for Sansa. Theon remains under Ramsay's control.

value.name: Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken
value.overview: Arya trains. Jorah and Tyrion run into slavers. Trystane and Myrcella make plans. Jaime and Bronn reach their destination. The Sand Snakes attack.

value.name: The Gift
value.overview: Jon prepares for conflict. Sansa tries to talk to Theon. Brienne waits for a sign. Stannis remains stubborn. Jaime attempts to reconnect with family.

value.name: Hardhome
value.overview: Arya makes progress in her training. Sansa confronts an old friend. Cersei struggles. Jon travels.

value.name: The Dance of Dragons
value.overview: Stannis confronts a troubling decision. Jon returns to The Wall. Mace visits the Iron Bank. Arya encounters someone from her past. Dany reluctantly oversees a traditional celebration of athleticism.

value.name: Mother's Mercy
value.overview: Stannis marches. Dany is surrounded by strangers. Cersei seeks forgiveness. Jon is challenged.

value.name: Season 6
value.overview: Following the shocking developments at the conclusion of season five, survivors from all parts of Westeros and Essos regroup to press forward, inexorably, towards their uncertain individual fates. Familiar faces will forge new alliances to bolster their strategic chances at survival, while new characters will emerge to challenge the balance of power in the east, west, north and south.

value.name: The Red Woman
value.overview: The fate of Jon Snow is revealed. Daenerys meets a strong man. Cersei sees her daughter once again.

value.name: Home
value.overview: Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven. In King’s Landing, Jaime advises Tommen. Tyrion demands good news, but has to make his own. At Castle Black, the Night’s Watch stands behind Thorne. Ramsay Bolton proposes a plan, and Balon Greyjoy entertains other proposals.

value.name: Oathbreaker
value.overview: Daenerys meets her future. Bran meets the past. Tommen confronts the High Sparrow. Arya trains to be No One. Varys finds an answer. Ramsay gets a gift.

value.name: Book of the Stranger
value.overview: Tyrion strikes a deal. Jorah and Daario undertake a difficult task. Jaime and Cersei try to improve their situation.

value.name: The Door
value.overview: Tyrion seeks a strange ally. Bran learns a great deal. Brienne goes on a mission. Arya is given a chance to prove herself.

value.name: Blood of My Blood
value.overview: An old foe comes back into the picture. Gilly meets Sam’s family. Arya faces a difficult choice. Jaime faces off against the High Sparrow.

value.name: The Broken Man
value.overview: The High Sparrow eyes another target. Jaime confronts a hero. Arya makes a plan. The North is reminded.

value.name: No One
value.overview: While Jaime weighs his options, Cersei answers a request. Tyrion's plans bear fruit. Arya faces a new test.

value.name: Battle of the Bastards
value.overview: As the Starks prepare to fight, Davos loses something dear. Ramsay plays a game. Daenerys faces a choice.

value.name: The Winds of Winter
value.overview: Tyrion counsels Daenerys on the upcoming campaign. Jon and Sansa discuss their future. Trials begin in King's Landing.

value.name: Season 7
value.overview: The long winter is here. And with it comes a convergence of armies and attitudes that have been brewing for years.

value.name: Dragonstone
value.overview: Jon organizes the defense of the North. Cersei tries to even the odds. Daenerys comes home.

value.name: Stormborn
value.overview: Daenerys receives an unexpected visitor. Jon faces a revolt. Tyrion plans the conquest of Westeros.

value.name: The Queen's Justice
value.overview: Daenerys holds court. Tyrion backchannels. Cersei returns a gift. Jaime learns from his mistakes.

value.name: The Spoils of War
value.overview: Daenerys fights back. Jaime faces an unexpected situation. Arya comes home.

value.name: Eastwatch
value.overview: Tyrion tries to find a way to make Daenerys listen to reason while Jon plans a dangerous new mission.

value.name: Beyond the Wall
value.overview: Jon and his team go beyond the wall to capture a wight. Daenerys has to make a tough decision.

value.name: The Dragon and the Wolf
value.overview: A meeting is held in King's Landing. Problems arise in the North.

value.name: Season 8
value.overview: The Great War has come, the Wall has fallen and the Night King's army of the dead marches towards Westeros. The end is here, but who will take the Iron Throne?

value.name: Winterfell
value.overview: Arriving at Winterfell, Jon and Daenerys struggle to unite a divided North. Jon Snow gets some big news.

value.name: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
value.overview: The battle at Winterfell is approaching. Jaime is confronted with the consequences of the past. A tense interaction between Sansa and Daenerys follows.

value.name: The Long Night
value.overview: The Night King and his army have arrived at Winterfell and the great battle begins. Arya looks to prove her worth as a fighter.

value.name: The Last of the Starks
value.overview: In the wake of a costly victory, Jon and Daenerys look to the south as Tyrion eyes a compromise that could save countless lives.

value.name: The Bells
value.overview: Daenerys brings her forces to King's Landing.

value.name: The Iron Throne
value.overview: In the aftermath of the devastating attack on King's Landing, Daenerys must face the survivors.

value.overview: A short look into the film-making process for the production Game of Thrones

value.overview: An approximately 15-minute preview of the first episode of Game of Thrones.

value.name: El Juego Comienza
value.overview: A spanish "Canal +`" production with interviews to some famous spanish movie directors like Alex de La Iglesia and extracts from last special "Making Game Of Thrones"

value.overview: A prequel to Game of Thrones Season 2 which recaps on the first season and gives insight into what's to come.

value.name: A Gathering Storm
value.overview: A prequel to Game of Thrones Season 3 which recaps on the first and second season and gives insight into what's to come.

value.name: Politics of Marriage
value.overview: Love and marriage? They don't go together so well in 'Game of Thrones' where the concept of matrimony is all about making power plays and political alliances. Cast and crew members along with author George R.R. Martin take a fascinating look at this ancient institution and its place in the hit HBO series.

value.name: Ice and Fire: A Foreshadowing
value.overview: Take a look back and a look forward to the fourth season of the hit HBO series, the show features clips from upcoming episodes, behind the scenes footage, interviews with talent, and cast members' answers to questions posed by fans.

value.name: The Politics of Power: A Look Back at Season 3
value.overview: Relive every thrilling, dramatic and tragic highlight from Season 3 of "Game of Thrones" in this comprehensive featurette. From Daenerys building a slave army to the infamous Red Wedding, not a detail is missed as recalled by the stars of the hit HBO series.

value.name: A Day in the Life
value.overview: The 30-minute special documents one epic day of production as tackled by hundreds of crew members across three countries. In addition to a behind-the-scenes look at the action in Dubrovnik, Croatia, Belfast, Northern Ireland and Seville, Spain, the preview includes several never-before-seen features.

value.name: The Story So Far (2015)
value.overview: Ahead of the eagerly-anticipated fifth season, we bring you up tp speed with the events of the epic fantasy drama to date. And to help the uninitiated ease into the wild world of Westeros, here's a beginner's guide to the fantasy epic.

value.name: World Premiere
value.overview: See the stars of Game of Thrones arrive at the Tower of London for the world premiere of the hit show's fifth season. Sue Perkins and Jamie East host.

value.name: Red Nose Day 'Game Of Thrones' Musical
value.overview: “George R.R. Martin meets Chris Martin – what could go wrong?” That’s Emilia Clarke in the epic, 12-minute video for Coldplay’s totally fake Game of Thrones musical, right before she rips into a song called “Rastafarian Targaryen.” Here’s a sample lyric: “Call me Daenerys Targaryen when you want to reach me, and if you feel the love then you can call me Khalessi.” The sketch, part of Red Nose Day, includes cast members Kit Harington, Peter Dinklage, John Bradley, Rose Leslie, Charlotte Pope, Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Alfie Allen and Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, who performs a piano ballad called “Closer to Home” to a photo of Lena Headey as Cersei. (“Are you thinking about Joffrey? Such a spirited lad. I was his uncle, I was also his dad.”)

value.name: The Story So Far (2016)
value.overview: Ahead of Season 6 of the epic saga, this special will bring viewers up to speed on the gripping storylines and compelling characters from the first five seasons. Writers and stars of the show give viewers an insight into key events of each season and explain the intrigues and power struggles at work in the lands of Westeros and beyond.

value.name: The Last Watch
value.overview: A documentary chronicling the fantasy drama’s eighth and final season. British documentarian Jeanie Finlay was embedded on the series’ set during production of the final six episodes, and the footage she captured during that time delves deep into the mud and blood to reveal the tears and triumphs involved in the challenge of bringing the fantasy world of Westeros to life in the very real studios, fields and car-parks of Northern Ireland.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Children of the Forest, the First Men, and the Andals
value.overview: Bran Stark recounts the legends surrounding the mysterious Children of the Forest and their wars against the First Men and the Andals.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Age of Heroes
value.overview: Bran Stark recounts the stories of legendary figures of several of the seven independent kingdoms that existed prior to the War of Conquest.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Old Gods and the New
value.overview: Catelyn and Bran Stark discuss the worship of the Old Gods of the Forest and the Seven in Westeros.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The History of the Night's Watch (Jeor Mormont)
value.overview: Jeor Mormont discusses the earliest days, structure and duty of the Night's Watch.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The History of the Night's Watch (Maester Luwin)
value.overview: Maester Luwin details the steady decline that the Night's Watch has suffered with the passage of time.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The History of the Night's Watch (Tywin Lannister)
value.overview: Tywin Lannister mocks the faded glory of the Night's Watch and questions the need for the order.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Order of the Maesters
value.overview: Maester Luwin explains the role and function of the Order of Maesters in the Seven Kingdoms as well as studies aspiring Maesters undergo.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Valyria and the Dragons
value.overview: Viserys Targaryen recounts the history of Valyria from its rise to becoming the greatest civilization the world has ever seen to its destruction in the Doom.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Field of Fire (Viserys Targaryen)
value.overview: Viserys Targaryen reflects on the victory which secured Aegon I Targaryen's domination of the Seven Kingdoms.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Field of Fire (Robb Stark)
value.overview: Robb Stark recalls how Aegon the Conqueror forced the lords of Westeros into submission with his brutal victory on the Field of Fire.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Mad King Aerys (Robert Baratheon)
value.overview: Robert Baratheon reflects on the actions of King Aerys II Targaryen and his son Rhaegar leading to his rebellion.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Mad King Aerys (Maester Luwin)
value.overview: Maester Luwin looks back on Prince Rhaegar's capture of Lyanna Stark and the horrific injustice inflicted on House Stark by the Mad King Aerys.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Mad King Aerys (Tywin Lannister)
value.overview: Tywin Lannister reminisces on the collapse of his alliance with Aerys as the latter descended further and further into madness.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Robert Baratheon)
value.overview: Robert Baratheon reminisces on his glorious victories against the supporters of the Mad King Aerys II Targaryen.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Viserys Targaryen)
value.overview: Viserys Targaryen bitterly recalls the treachery of the Usurper Robert Baratheon putting an end to the Targaryen dynasty.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Sack of King's Landing (Viserys Targaryen)
value.overview: Viserys Targaryen bitterly recounts Tywin Lannister's treachery bringing down the Targaryen dynasty.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Sack of King's Landing (Robert Baratheon)
value.overview: Robert Baratheon reflects on his victory over the Targaryen dynasty and the necessity for the death of Rhaegar Targaryen's children.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Sack of King's Landing (Maester Luwin)
value.overview: Maester Luwin details the downfall of the Mad King and the death of the royal family, as well as how it impacted those who won the war.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Sack of King's Landing (Tywin Lannister)
value.overview: Tywin Lannister reminisces on the part he played in defeating the Targaryens and the rewards his family reaped for it.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Stark
value.overview: Bran and Robb Stark discuss House Stark's reign as the Kings of Winter before kneeling to Aegon the Conqueror.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Lannister
value.overview: Tywin Lannister recalls how House Lannister survived and rose to prominence through cunning.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Targaryen
value.overview: Viserys Targaryen recounts the conquest of House Targaryen and its ruling of the Seven Kingdoms before being brought down by the treacherous Usurper Robert Baratheon.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Baratheon
value.overview: Robert Baratheon recalls the victories that led to House Baratheon cementing themselves as one of the greatest houses in Westeros.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Arryn
value.overview: Catelyn Stark speaks of the origins of House Arryn and the conquest of the Vale during the Andal Invasion and its role in Robert's Rebellion.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Greyjoy Rebellion (Robb Stark)
value.overview: Robb Stark reminisces about his father going to war to put an end to Balon Greyjoy's rebellion and the impact it had on his family.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Greyjoy Rebellion (Theon Greyjoy)
value.overview: Theon Greyjoy reflects on his father's failed rebellion and the penalties his family suffered as a result of it.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Greyjoy Rebellion (Stannis Baratheon)
value.overview: Stannis Baratheon recounts serving under his brother Robert when Balon Greyjoy rebelled against the Iron Throne, as well as how he would have done things differently had he been king.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Stannis Baratheon)
value.overview: Stannis Baratheon reflects on his brother Robert's rebellion against the Mad King Aerys II Targaryen and his own part in it, as well as his bitterness for not being justly rewarded.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Davos Seaworth)
value.overview: Davos Seaworth recounts his lowly beginnings and days as a smuggler as well as the event that brought him into the service of Stannis Baratheon.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Margaery Tyrell)
value.overview: Margaery Tyrell details House Tyrell's loyalty to House Targaryen before the rebellion and to House Baratheon afterwards.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Catelyn Stark)
value.overview: Catelyn Stark reminisces on the rebellion and how it affected the family she was born into as well as the one she married into.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Tyrell
value.overview: Margaery Tyrell details House Tyrell's history serving under House Gardener before the War of Conquest and House Targaryen afterwards, before surrendering to Robert Baratheon after he defeated the Targaryen dynasty.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Greyjoy
value.overview: Theon and Yara Greyjoy divulge the history of the ironborn and how House Greyjoy became the dominant family of the Iron Islands.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Clegane
value.overview: Sandor Clegane recounts House Clegane's humble beginnings, as well as how he and his brother Gregor became two of the most infamous killers in Westeros.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Free Folk
value.overview: Ygritte discusses the history and culture of the Free Folk in comparison to that of the inhabitants of the Seven Kingdoms.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Night's Watch
value.overview: Ygritte recites the history of the Night's Watch and their oppression of the Free Folk.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Dragonstone
value.overview: Stannis Baratheon recounts the history of the island Dragonstone, from the landing of the Targaryens to his own unwanted ruling of it.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Harrenhal
value.overview: Catelyn Stark details the rise and fall of the supposedly impenetrable fortress Harrenhal and the terrifying legends that have plagued its ruins ever since.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Free Cities
value.overview: Jorah Mormont explains the rise of the “Free Cities” of Essos in the wake of Valyria’s Doom, detailing how the cities differ and what one can expect to find in each one.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Qarth
value.overview: Xaro Xhoan Daxos explains Qarth’s role in Essos’ commerce, and how the merchant council known as the Thirteen rules the city to ensure it remains the greatest city that was or ever will be.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Drowned God
value.overview: Yara Greyjoy explains the worship of the Drowned God, His importance in the Iron Islands, and the legends of His halls beneath the waves.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Alchemists' Guild
value.overview: Wisdom Hallyne provides an account of the Alchemist Guild (or Pyromancers), detailing their knowledge of wildfire and how their once great influence in Westeros has faded over the years.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Warlocks
value.overview: Xaro Xhoan Daxos explains the mysterious order of the warlocks and their relationship with the House of the Undying, their center of power.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Old Ghis & Slaver's Bay
value.overview: Jorah Mormont charts the rise and fall of the Ghiscari Empire, including its battles with the Valyrian Freehold and the slaver cities that carry on in the wake of its destruction.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Unsullied
value.overview: Jorah Mormont recounts the legendary Battle of Qohor, in which three thousand Unsullied slave-warriors held off an entire Dothraki horde outside the gates of Qohor.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Reed
value.overview: Meera Reed discusses the history and modern perceptions of House Reed, leaders of the crannogmen, the mysterious swamp-dwelling gatekeepers of the North.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Bolton
value.overview: Roose Bolton discusses the history of House Bolton, one of the great houses of the North, despite their often unsavory reputation.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Frey
value.overview: Catelyn Stark tracks the House Frey’s quick rise to wealth and power through control of the Crossing, as well as their current reputation under the prickly and resentful Lord Walder Frey.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Tully
value.overview: Brynden Tully details the history of House Tully, the noble and diplomatic Lords Paramount of the Riverlands.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Lord of Light
value.overview: Thoros of Myr details his personal history as a follower of the Lord of Light, from his skeptical youth in Myr, to his visions in the flames that have made him a believer.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Wargs and the Sight
value.overview: Bran Stark explains the legendary abilities of warging and the Sight, skills that, although innate to the mythical Children of the Forest, only present themselves in modern men on rare occasion.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Petyr Baelish and Varys)
value.overview: Petyr Baelish and Varys debate the ramifications of Robert Baratheon’s rebellion against the Mad King Aerys II Targaryen, and its impact on the realm.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Red Keep
value.overview: Joffrey Baratheon reveals the history and structure of the Red Keep, the main fortress of King’s Landing, from its construction by the Targaryens, to its hidden lower dungeons.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The North
value.overview: Jon Snow describes the vast, cold and unforgiving North, which stretches from the Neck to the Wall, and has served as the barrier between the Seven Kingdoms and the horrors beyond the Wall for thousands of years.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Reach
value.overview: Margaery Tyrell discusses the history, customs, and noble houses of the Reach, the fertile region known for chivalry, knightly tournaments, farms, and vineyards.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Riverlands
value.overview: Brynden Tully recounts the history of the Riverlands, one of the most desirable-and most fought over-regions in the Seven Kingdoms.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Stormlands
value.overview: Brienne of Tarth recounts the tumultuous history of the Stormlands, from the constant battles waged by the Storm Kings, to the relative peace under Targaryen rule, to Robert’s Rebellion.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Westerlands
value.overview: Tywin Lannister reveals the history of the Westerlands, and the true strength behind the richest region of the Seven Kingdoms; House Lannister.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Vale
value.overview: Petyr Baelish delves into the history of the Vale, from its mythical beginnings to the impregnable Eyrie, the noble House Arryn, and the unpredictable Hill Tribes.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Martell
value.overview: Oberyn Martell discusses the history and reputation of House Martell, the strong-willed ruling family of Dorne that refused to join the Seven Kingdoms for centuries.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Baelish
value.overview: Petyr Baelish explains how, despite humble beginnings, House Baelish has rapidly risen to power, thanks mostly to his own wit and ambition.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Dragons
value.overview: Grand Maester Pycelle recounts the mysterious origins, magical powers, and inexplicable downfall of history's last generation of dragons.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Poisons
value.overview: Oberyn Martell explains the sources, surreptitious uses, and lethal effects of the many poisons circulating throughout Westeros and Essos.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Bastards of Westeros
value.overview: Ellaria Sand explains the shame cast upon bastards throughout much of Westeros, and how these unwanted children can tear families and kingdoms apart.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Iron Bank of Braavos
value.overview: Tycho Nestoris reveals the history behind the legendary Iron Bank of Braavos, an institution renowned for its economic power and formidable reputation.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Sellswords & Hedge Knights
value.overview: Bronn describes the unique profession and skill of the sellsword, as well as the debatable merits of the hedge knight.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Oberyn Martell)
value.overview: Oberyn Martell reveals the Dornish perspective of Robert's Rebellion - or the War of the Usurper as they call it - including the murder of his sister, Elia Martell, during the sack of King's Landing.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Wall
value.overview: Samwell Tarly explains the impressive construction and function of the Wall, including its natural defenses against wildling attempts to scale, breach, and circumnavigate it.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Nations of the North
value.overview: Tormund Giantsbane describes the varied clans of Free Folk living beyond the Wall, from Thenns to the Hornfoots to the Giants, all of whom Mance Rayder has rallied to his cause.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Kingsguard (Jaime Lannister)
value.overview: Jaime Lannister details the heroes and storied triumphs of the Kingsguard believed to be the most honorable knights in the realm.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Kingsguard (Bronn)
value.overview: Bronn sheds some light on the unfavorable moments from the Kingsguard's history, including their blind loyalty for less-than-honorable kings.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Maester's Chain
value.overview: Qyburn explains the significance of the Maester's Chain, a symbolic ornament earned by students of The Citadel, with each link representing the mastery of a different subject.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Death of Kings
value.overview: Varys tracks the lives and all too common deaths of the Kings of Westeros over the years, proving that the Iron Throne is truly an uncomfortable seat to hold.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Valyrian Steel
value.overview: Jorah Mormont details the mysterious properties of Valyrian Steel, a metal considered magical that was used to forge the blades of the great Houses of Westeros.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Justice of the Seven Kingdoms
value.overview: Bronn offers his view on the Seven Kingdoms' questionable methods of justice, including the dramatic trial by combat and the rarely invoked trial by Seven.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Seven-Pointed Star
value.overview: The High Sparrow details how "The Seven-Pointed Star" has influenced followers of the Faith of the Seven throughout the centuries.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Faith Militant
value.overview: The High Sparrow narrates the origins of the Faith Militant, its rebellion against House Targaryen that plunged the realm into war, and its ultimate decline and disbandment.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Volantis
value.overview: Varys discusses the history of Volantis, the oldest of the Free Cities from its humble beginnings as the first colony of Valyria.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Braavos
value.overview: Tycho Nestoris explains the history behind the beautiful city of Braavos, from the Titan who inhabits the harbor, to the world-renowned swordsmanship of the city's "bravos."

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Faceless Men
value.overview: Tycho Nestoris discusses the mysterious guild of assassins known as the Faceless Men.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Winterfell
value.overview: Roose Bolton gives his views on Winterfell and how the House Bolton influenced its creation and expansion before seizing it.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Lord Commanders
value.overview: Acting Lord Commander Alliser Thorne talks about the purpose of the Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, how he is chosen, and recalls some of the more noteworthy Lord Commanders, who made history through their folly.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Barristan Selmy)
value.overview: Barristan Selmy recounts how he was named to the Kingsguard, saw King Aerys descend into madness but revered Prince Rhaegar Targaryen. Barristan describes the fateful Tourney at Harrenhal, the ensuing War of the Five Kings, and how he fought beside Rhaegar at the Battle of the Trident where he was killed.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Dorne
value.overview: Ellaria Sand narrates a brief history of Dorne from the migration of the First Men to the present day.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Fighting Pits of Meereen
value.overview: Daario Naharis describes the history of the fighting pits of Meereen, the different types of fights that occur there, and the lives that the more-skilled fighters lead.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The River Rhoyne
value.overview: Varys talks about the Rhoyne, the largest river of Essos, and the people who originally inhabited it, the Rhoynar, and the war they fought against the Dragonlords.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Many-Faced God
value.overview: A man known as "Jaqen H'ghar" discusses the Many-Faced God, the syncretic god of death worshiped by the cult of assassins known as the Faceless Men.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Greyscale and the Stone Men
value.overview: Qyburn discusses the dreaded plague known as Greyscale, and its advanced victims known as "Stone Men".

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Great Masters of Meereen
value.overview: Missandei of Naath discusses the self-styled "Great Masters", the powerful aristocratic slaver families that rule over Meereen, the largest city in Slaver's Bay.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Dance of Dragons
value.overview: The great Targaryen civil war known as the Dance of the Dragons is discussed by Shireen Baratheon, Viserys Targaryen, Oberyn Martell, Robert Baratheon, Catelyn Stark, and Joffrey Baratheon.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Old Way
value.overview: Euron Greyjoy remembers the origins of the Old Way of the Ironborn in their days of glory, and how a brutal and bloody leader tried to recover it during the Dance of the Dragons.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Kingsmoot
value.overview: Euron Greyjoy discusses the origins of the tradition of the Kingsmoot, and he names the most famous and bloodthirsty kings named under this tradition.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Summer Sea
value.overview: Euron Greyjoy outlines the cultures and peoples he has witnessed in his travels and incursions for the Summer Sea.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The War of the Ninepenny Kings
value.overview: Brother Ray recounts the War of the Ninepenny Kings from the perspective of a peasant who was recruited by his Lord as a soldier, with all the sufferings and tragedies that this meant for his life.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Great Tourney at Harrenhal
value.overview: Meera Reed tells the story that her father told her during her childhood about the infamous tournament at Harrenhal, the biggest tournament in Westeros' history, in which a mysterious knight tested the honor of the great Lords.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Jaime Lannister)
value.overview: Jaime Lannister looks back on his appointment as a brother of the Kingsguard, with all the secret interests involved, and how it led to his infamous participation in the end of the Robert's Rebellion.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Vaes Dothrak
value.overview: Jorah Mormont explains the structure and places of interest of Vaes Dothrak, the vast capital of Dothraki people, and mentions some of the rituals practiced there by the Dosh khaleen.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Dothraki
value.overview: Jorah Mormont details the history of the first major migration of the Dothraki after the Doom of Valyria towards Central Essos, and how the newly invaded invaders destroyed the civilizations of what would later become the Dothraki Sea.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Northern Allegiances to House Stark
value.overview: Sansa Stark recounts the history of the North, of how it was once unified by the House Stark, of how its principal noble houses swore loyalty to them, and how they guaranteed its independence from the Andals, while she prepares herself from the Wall to confront those who now govern it.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Children of the Forest vs. the First Men
value.overview: The Three-Eyed Raven recounts the wars between the Children of the Forest and the First Men, and how they led to the conflict now threatening Westeros.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Brotherhood Without Banners
value.overview: Thoros of Myr explains the origin that led to the conformation of the Brotherhood Without Banners, and how it assumed the mission of protecting the smallfolk.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Oldtown
value.overview: Grand Maester Pycelle and Qyburn debate the records and theories about the history of Oldtown, the oldest city of Westeros, the noble house that governs it and the Citadel, the refuge and home of the noble order of the Maesters

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Dayne
value.overview: The young Eddard Stark recounts the history of House Dayne, the former kings and lords of Starfall, and how they have been linked to their legendary sword Dawn, especially his last and greatest bearer, Arthur Dayne, the Sword of the Morning.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Little Birds
value.overview: Varys recounts his own origins, and how he created his network of spies he calls his little birds.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Knights of the Vale
value.overview: Petyr Baelish highlights on arrival at the first of the Andals invaders who went on to become the great knights of the Vale of Arryn.

value.name: Histories & Lore: House Tarly
value.overview: Randyll Tarly reflects on the history of House Tarly, and his own story with his eldest son Samwell.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Riverrun
value.overview: Brynden Tully details the history of Riverrun, the ancestral castle of the House Tully , and the strengths that have allowed it to resist millennia of wars.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Great Sept of Baelor
value.overview: The High Sparrow recounts the history of the Great Sept of Baelor, the largest Sept of the Faith of the Seven, and the pious King who built it, Baelor the Blessed.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Dragonpit
value.overview: Varys and Qyburn recall the era when Targaryen dragons were housed in King's Landing.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Citadel
value.overview: Samwell Tarly tells the history of the Citadel, the center of learning where maesters earn their chains.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Casterly Rock
value.overview: Jaime Lannister recounts the founding of his ancestral home, Casterly Rock.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Highgarden
value.overview: Randyll Tarly describes the battles, marriages, and alliances surrounding Highgarden, the seat of House Tyrell.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Golden Company
value.overview: Jorah Mormont explains the history of the Golden Company - a band of mercenaries who have built their reputation on never having lost a battle.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Prophecies of the Known World
value.overview: Samwell Tarly enumerates on the roles prophecies play in Westeros and Essos alike.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Hand of the King
value.overview: Petyr Baelish details the successes and failures of past Hands of the King.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Rains of Castamere
value.overview: Jaime Lannister provides the gruesome backstory surrounding "The Rains of Castamere."

value.name: Histories & Lore: King's Landing
value.overview: Varys explains the origins and the workings of King's Landing.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Greyjoy Rebellion (Jaime Lannister and Euron Greyjoy)
value.overview: Jaime Lannister and Euron Greyjoy argue their perspectives of the Greyjoy Rebellion.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Blackfyres
value.overview: Varys explains the backstory of House Blackfyre.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The South
value.overview: Tormund shares the Free Folks' perspective of Westeros south of The Wall and its inhabitants.

value.name: Histories & Lore: The Defiance of Duskendale
value.overview: Varys explains the details of the Defiance of Duskendale and how this event forever changed Aerys II Targaryen for the worse.

value.name: Histories & Lore: Maegor the Cruel
value.overview: Varys recounts the terrifying history of Maegor Targaryen, also known as "Maegor the Cruel".

value.name: The Real History Behind Game of Thrones (Part 1)
value.overview: Watch historians, along with George R. R. Martin, explore the interweaving inspirations of the actual players in the era known as "The Wars of the Roses" and other historical events in this two-part series.

value.name: The Real History Behind Game of Thrones (Part 2)
value.overview: Watch historians, along with George R. R. Martin, explore the interweaving inspirations of the actual players in the era known as "The Wars of the Roses" and other historical events in this two-part series.

value.name: Squid Game
value.overview: Hundreds of cash-strapped players accept a strange invitation to compete in children's games—with high stakes. But, a tempting prize awaits the victor.

value.name: Season 1
value.overview: Hundreds of cash-strapped players accept a strange invitation to compete in children's games. Inside, a tempting prize awaits — with deadly high stakes.

value.name: Red Light, Green Light
value.overview: Hoping to win easy money, a broke and desperate Gi-hun agrees to take part in an enigmatic game. Not long into the first round, unforeseen horrors unfold.

value.name: Hell
value.overview: Split on whether to continue or quit, the group holds a vote. But their realities in the outside world may prove to be just as unforgiving as the game.

value.name: The Man with the Umbrella
value.overview: A few players enter the next round — which promises equal doses of sweet and deadly — with hidden advantages. Meanwhile, Jun-ho sneaks his way inside.

value.name: Stick to the Team
value.overview: As alliances form among the players, no one is safe in the dorm after lights-out. The third game challenges Gi-hun's team to think strategically.

value.name: A Fair World
value.overview: Gi-hun and his team take turns keeping guard through the night. The masked men encounter trouble with their co-conspirators.

value.name: Gganbu
value.overview: Players pair off for the fourth game. Gi-hun grapples with a moral dilemma, Sang-woo chooses self-preservation and Sae-byeok shares her untold story.

value.name: VIPS
value.overview: The Masked Leader welcomes VIP guests to the facility for a front-row viewing of the show. In the fifth game, some players crack under pressure.

value.name: Front Man
value.overview: Ahead of the last round, distrust and disgust run deep among the finalists. Jun-ho makes a getaway, determined to expose the game's dirty secrets.

value.name: One Lucky Day
value.overview: The final round presents another cruel test — but this time, how it ends depends on just one player. The game's creator steps out of the shadows.

value.name: The Blacklist
value.overview: Raymond "Red" Reddington, one of the FBI's most wanted fugitives, surrenders in person at FBI Headquarters in Washington, D.C. He claims that he and the FBI have the same interests: bringing down dangerous criminals and terrorists. In the last two decades, he's made a list of criminals and terrorists that matter the most but the FBI cannot find because it does not know they exist. Reddington calls this "The Blacklist". Reddington will co-operate, but insists that he will speak only to Elizabeth Keen, a rookie FBI profiler.

value.name: Season 1
value.overview: For decades, ex-government agent Raymond "Red" Reddington has been one of the FBI’s Most Wanted fugitives. Brokering shadowy deals for criminals across the globe, Red was known by many as the "Concierge of Crime." Now, he’s mysteriously surrendered to the FBI with an explosive offer: he will help catch the world’s most elusive criminals, under the condition that he speaks only to Elizabeth "Liz" Keen, an FBI profiler fresh out of Quantico. For Liz, it’s going to be one hell of a first day on the job.

value.name: Pilot
value.overview: The race to stop a terrorist begins in the premiere of this crime series about a most-wanted fugitive who works with a rookie FBI profiler to take down criminals and evildoers.

value.name: The Freelancer
value.overview: Red and Liz go under cover to stop an assassin known as The Freelancer from killing his next target; Ressler and a recently re-hired CIA agent try to protect Red from a distance; Liz wonders what she should do about Tom and the mysterious box.

value.name: Wujing
value.overview: The FBI is on the hunt for a high-ranking Chinese spy, Wujing which Red claims has hired him to help decode a classified CIA transmission. Liz, posing as an FBI cryptographer goes with Red to decode the message while protecting US government secrets. Meanwhile, Liz proactively investigates Tom.

value.name: The Stewmaker
value.overview: While continuing her investigation into the truth about Tom, Liz testifies against drug lord, Hector Lorca. Later another witness is abducted when he is forced to testify against the dangerous drug trafficker. Red’s interest is peaked and he informs the team that the witness may have been taken by "The Stewmaker" a man responsible for hundreds of missing and presumed dead people. Meanwhile, in an unlikely twist of events, Red and Ressler must work together for the first time.

value.name: The Courier
value.overview: Red and the FBI try to stop a dangerous messenger (Robert Knepper) whose appearance is unknown; Liz is thrust into a kidnapping plot.

value.name: Gina Zanetakos
value.overview: Tom claims he is innocent and wants to turn the box into the FBI; Red's next target is a beautiful and deadly corporate terrorist (Margarita Levieva).

value.name: Frederick Barnes
value.overview: The FBI searches for the man responsible for a chemical attack on a subway; Liz wants to avoid Red after he implicated Tom.

value.name: General Ludd
value.overview: When Red reveals a new name, Liz learns of a plot to destroy the country's financial system; Tom helps Liz when a loved one falls ill.

value.name: Anslo Garrick (1)
value.overview: Anslo Garrick, the newest person on the blacklist, tries to capture Red; Liz is caught in an elevator.

value.name: Anslo Garrick (2)
value.overview: Liz infiltrates the blacksite and disarms the signal jammers to call in backup but runs into trouble along the way. The fate of Ressler hangs in the balance as Red tries to bargain with Anslo Garrick. Meanwhile, Tom becomes increasingly worried about Liz’ situation and the fate of Red is unknown.

value.name: The Good Samaritan Killer
value.overview: A serial killer from Liz's past strikes again while Red hunts for whoever betrayed him.

value.name: The Alchemist
value.overview: Red informs the team that "The Alchemist" - a man who relies upon science to transform a person’s DNA - has been contracted to protect a well-known mob informant and his wife. As the team goes undercover to catch him, Liz finds herself on the hunt for an unlikely couple. Meanwhile Liz and Tom find themselves at another bump in their relationship and Ressler debates whether or not he should give his ex-girlfriend his blessing.

value.name: The Cyprus Agency
value.overview: After a recent spate of abductions of babies from their mothers, Red informs Liz that the "Cyprus Agency" is the illegal adoption organization responsible. Coincidentally, Liz and Tom contemplate adoption of their own which fuels Liz to track down the organizations CEO, Owen Mallory.

value.name: Madeline Pratt
value.overview: Liz helps Tom adjust to the impending adoption; Red reveals a woman from his past is a target; Red convinces Liz to pull of a heist at the Syrian Embassy.

value.name: The Judge
value.overview: Red believes he knows who was responsible for a prominent prosecutor's 12 year disappearance; Red investigates the woman who tempts Tom.

value.name: Mako Tanida
value.overview: One of Red's former associates, a crime lord, becomes the next target; Tom decides to confront Jolene.

value.name: Ivan
value.overview: After a cyber defense asset is stolen by a terrorist only known as Ivan, Red and Liz discover a cover-up; new evidence regarding Jolene's disappearance unravels some of the mystery surrounding Tom.

value.name: Milton Bobbit
value.overview: Red and the team search for a life insurance claim adjuster who talks people into becoming contract killers; Liz and Red try to uncover Tom's secrets.

value.name: The Pavlovich Brothers
value.overview: As the team tries to protect a target of the Pavlovich brothers -- specialists in abductions -- Red has a job of his own for the duo; Liz patiently pursues the truth about Tom.

value.name: The Kingmaker
value.overview: Red thinks the Kingmaker (Linus Roache), a strategist, is responsible when a politician in Prague is framed for murder; Liz uncovers a secret Red has been hiding.

value.name: Berlin (1)
value.overview: After discovering the truth behind her father's death, Liz refuses to work with Red, just as his situation grows desperate.

value.name: Berlin: Conclusion (2)
value.overview: In the stunning Season 1 finale, Liz is forced to reunite with Red in order to track down Berlin.

value.name: Season 2
value.overview: For decades, ex-government agent Raymond "Red" Reddington has been one of the FBI's Most Wanted fugitives. He mysteriously surrendered to the FBI but now the FBI works for him as he identifies a "blacklist" of politicians, mobsters, spies and international terrorists. He will help catch them all... with the caveat that Elizabeth "Liz" Keen continues to work as his partner. Red will teach Liz to think like a criminal and "see the bigger picture"... whether she wants to or not.

value.name: Lord Baltimore
value.overview: While continuing to battle Berlin, Red faces a new threat in the form of Lord Baltimore. A figure from Red's past returns. Liz tries to move on after her showdown with Tom.

value.name: Monarch Douglas Bank
value.overview: A robbery provides Red with an opportunity to take down a questionable bank. Liz questions Red's intentions during the course of her investigation. An impressive addition is made to Cooper's team.

value.name: Dr. James Covington
value.overview: When a body is found missing a heart, Liz and Ressler join forces with Samar Navabi to investigate Dr. Covington's operation. Red and an associate try to take advantage of an opportunity in Indonesia.

value.name: Dr. Linus Creel
value.overview: Red thinks a dangerous sociopsychological experiment may be taking place when several previously nonviolent citizens become killers. Red has a complicated proposition for Naomi and her husband.

value.name: The Front
value.overview: The team targets an eco-terrorist cell seeking a deadly weapon. Liz attempts to lose her guardian. Red resorts to manipulation to pursue a special someone.

value.name: The Mombasa Cartel
value.overview: Liz asks Red for information about deadly wildlife poachers after a mutilated corpse washes ashore. Ressler forms a dangerous habit.

value.name: The Scimitar
value.overview: A plot for revenge emerges after an Iranian nuclear scientist is assassinated. Liz and Ressler wind up in a predicament.

value.name: The Decembrist
value.overview: Red's plans for Berlin take a sudden turn after he finds out that he was manipulated by the latest Blacklister to avenge Red.

value.name: Luther Braxton (1)
value.overview: When Red is arrested and taken to a secret detention facility, Liz and the task force set out to save him before he disappears forever. At the facility, Red encounters a thief with whom he shares a complicated history.

value.name: Luther Braxton: Conclusion (2)
value.overview: As chaos ensues at the Factory, leaving the fate of Red and the task force unknown, Cooper struggles to rescue his team from the detention facility. It’s a race against time to prevent Luther Braxton attaining confidential information.

value.name: Ruslan Denisov
value.overview: When an undercover CIA agent is kidnapped by a band of separatists in Uzbekistan, the task force sets a rescue mission in motion. Red informs Liz and Ressler that they are up against a very dangerous former associate.

value.name: The Kenyon Family
value.overview: When Red tips Liz off about the disappearance of a polygamous cult leader with dangerous shipping containers buried on his property, the task force sets out to investigate. Red utilizes his sources to appease Fitch’s last words and tries to track down his hidden safe.

value.name: The Deer Hunter
value.overview: Red helps Liz and the task force find a killer -- the Deer Hunter -- who tracks victims like prey.

value.name: T. Earl King VI
value.overview: A former paramour involves Reddington in a deadly game with a wealthy, powerful family dynasty whose ill-begotten fortune was amassed from an underground auction of human and material contraband. Meanwhile, Tom takes on a new mission.

value.name: The Major
value.overview: When Agent Keen is questioned in court as a suspect in the murder of the DC Harbormaster, her unusual relationship with Red and their task force falls under scrutiny. Meanwhile, Red enlists Cooper and Ressler to locate "The Major," a dangerous former associate who is key in keeping Liz out of prison.

value.name: Tom Keen
value.overview: Evidence mounts against Liz in a murder case, triggering Red and Ressler's efforts to clear her name by tracking down the recently vanished Tom Keen.

value.name: The Longevity Initiative
value.overview: The task force tracks a scientist who abducts disabled patients to conduct experiments on immortality. Now back in Washington, DC, Tom scrambles to save himself from new enemies.

value.name: Vanessa Cruz
value.overview: The task force tracks a provocative female Blacklister, a frame-up artist who targets the wealthy elite. Tom pleads for Liz's help. Red pressures Liz for the Fulcrum, claiming it's now a matter of life and death.

value.name: Leonard Caul
value.overview: Red fights for his life while the task force races to track down a mysterious figure from his past while Tom provides help in an unexpected way.

value.name: Quon Zhang
value.overview: After decoding the information that is embedded in The Fulcrum, Red is determined to stop the imminent threat. Meanwhile, the task force discovers that deceased bodies of Chinese-American women are being smuggled out of the country under false identities. Liz continues to search for answers about her past after discovering a picture hidden in Red's secret flat.

value.name: Karakurt
value.overview: Following intel from Red, the FBI find themselves one-step behind the most dangerous Russian Assassin, Karakurt, an enemy on U.S. soil. To avoid catastrophe, Liz and Ressler meet with Russian Counter-Intelligence who offer insight not only on Karakurt, but also on the identity of Liz’s mother. Cooper finds himself in a compromising position.

value.name: Tom Connolly
value.overview: In the season finale Liz realizes she is being framed by The Cabal forcing Red to use his connections to help her clear her name. As Cooper receives shocking news, Ressler, Samar, and Aram must decide who on the task force can still be trusted.

value.name: Season 3
value.overview: Now a fugitive on the run, Liz must figure out how to protect herself from the fallout of her actions in the explosive season two finale.

value.name: The Troll Farmer
value.overview: With the FBI hunting Liz for the murder of the attorney general, she and Red go on the run. Red reaches out to a contact for help fleeing the city.

value.name: Marvin Gerard
value.overview: With Ressler in hot pursuit, Liz only has Red to trust; Red asks a lawyer named Marvin Gerard for help with a hostage situation. The FBI wants to force Cooper out of the task force.

value.name: Eli Matchett
value.overview: Liz and Red take a detour to the Midwest. Ressler, Aram and Samar accidentally uncover what could turn into a global food crisis. Cooper seeks help from an unexpected source.

value.name: The Djinn
value.overview: Red enlists a task force to locate the Djinn, an enigmatic woman who fulfills revenge fantasies. Red and Liz believe the Djinn can lead them to the Cabal and help them exonerate Liz.

value.name: Arioch Cain
value.overview: Red and the FBI come together to protect Liz when a huge reward for her capture attracts attention from assassins.

value.name: Sir Crispin Crandall
value.overview: Red and Liz catch wind that Andras Halmi, a trusted advisor of The Director, has gone missing. In pursuit of Halmi, Red and Liz narrowly escape a violent confrontation. Meanwhile, Tom ends up in a brutal "Fight Club" to find the one man he thinks will be able to exonerate Liz.

value.name: Zal Bin Hasaan
value.overview: A family tragedy in Samar's past resurfaces when the Task Force hunt for an elusive international terrorist. The FBI and the Cabal gain significant ground in their search for Liz and Red. Meanwhile, Tom encounters complications in his plan to exonerate Liz.

value.name: Kings of the Highway
value.overview: Red and Liz are unexpectedly separated from each other when Red falls into a dangerous situation. Samar makes a risky decision to help Liz while Tom and Cooper continue on their expedition to exonerate Liz.

value.name: The Director (1)
value.overview: Liz awaits trial as Red and Aram take risky measures to protect her.

value.name: The Director: Conclusion (2)
value.overview: The Cabal prepares to assassinate Liz, triggering Red's call to the task force to outmaneuver the Cabal in a bid to exonerate her. Red delivers a final ultimatum.

value.name: Mr. Gregory Devry
value.overview: With her name finally cleared, Liz attempts to reclaim her former life. Red works with the task force to infiltrate an assembly of high-level criminals at large in a rare, risky opportunity to capture the heads of the world's most lethal organized crime syndicates.

value.name: The Vehm
value.overview: When an associate of Red's is killed with a rare medieval device, Red realizes a lethal vigilante group from the Middle Ages has been resurrected; Liz considers her next move after receiving shocking news.

value.name: Alistair Pitt
value.overview: Red and Liz work with the taskforce to stop a negotiator who has resurfaced to unite two rival crime families. Tom reconnects with a former flame.

value.name: Lady Ambrosia
value.overview: After a missing child that has been presumed dead turns up alive, Red and Liz work with the taskforce to search for a dangerous woman who may be kidnapping children. Meanwhile, Tom faces shocking consequences after his plan to help Liz goes awry.

value.name: Drexel
value.overview: After the founder of a successful internet start-up is found dead, Red recognizes the crime scene as the work of a notorious killer. Liz and the task force work with Red to track the murderer through a dangerous underground news source. Meanwhile, Tom faces a life threatening situation, while Liz considers options for her baby.

value.name: The Caretaker
value.overview: After a State Department official is found dead in Beijing, Red and Liz link the murder to a secret keeper known as "The Caretaker," who maintains an impenetrable safety deposit vault for criminals. Red and Liz work with the task force to find the Caretaker and his collection of lethal and classified secrets. Meanwhile, Tom makes a risky decision, while Liz persists on her quest to find out more about her mother.

value.name: Mr. Solomon (1)
value.overview: After Red learns that a tactical nuclear weapon is being targeted by thieves, it's a race against the clock as the task force struggles to stop them -- and prevent an imminent nuclear disaster. Meanwhile, Tom and Liz make a decision that will change their relationship forever.

value.name: Mr. Solomon: Conclusion (2)
value.overview: A team member falls into grave danger due to a tragedy, leading the task force to rely on Red and his unorthodox methods. Meanwhile, an unforeseen complication impacts Tom and Liz.

value.name: Cape May
value.overview: When a mysterious woman running from unknown assailants accidentally crosses paths with Reddington, he assists her in fighting her attackers.

value.name: The Artax Network
value.overview: After an unexpected loss devastates the FBI task force, they must track down their assailants; a mysterious group whose agents operate using a worldwide satellite network. Meanwhile, Reddington is forced to confront a ghost from his past -- one who knows many of Red's secrets.

value.name: Susan Hargrave
value.overview: When Reddington links an elegant, powerful and extremely dangerous woman to the recent tragic events, the task force is forced to play a deadly cat and mouse game to stop her before she strikes again.

value.name: Alexander Kirk (1)
value.overview: The FBI task force's hunt for revenge nears its endgame. As Reddington and the team close in on the mysterious arch-criminal responsible for recent tragic events, they're forced to operate outside their comfort zone – and outside the law – in order to take down their enemy once and for all.

value.name: Alexander Kirk: Conclusion (2)
value.overview: As Reddington and the task force close in on the person responsible for Liz's death, a shocking betrayal leaves them racing to save one of their own.

value.name: Season 4
value.overview: A mysterious man claiming to be Liz’s real father targets her, but first she must resolve the mystery of her lost childhood and reconcile her true identity with the elusive memories corrupted by Reddington. Without the truth, every day holds more danger for herself, her baby and her husband Tom. Meanwhile, the Task Force reels from Liz’s resurrection and friendships are fractured. Betrayed by those closest to him, Reddington’s specific moral code demands justice, all the while battling an army of new and unexpected blacklisters.

value.name: Esteban
value.overview: After Liz is abducted by a man claiming to be her father, Red sets out to find her at any cost.  Meanwhile, the Task Force grapples with the shocking news that Liz is still alive.

value.name: Mato
value.overview: Red enlists Tom and the Task Force to help track a notorious bounty hunter who may know Alexander Kirk's next move. Meanwhile, Liz struggles to decide if Kirk is trustworthy.

value.name: Miles McGrath
value.overview: Red and the Task Force take extreme measures to hunt down one of  Alexander Kirk's allies, Miles McGrath, a "criminal incubator" who  finances crimes for profit. Meanwhile, Liz learns more about her family.

value.name: Gaia
value.overview: As Red sets Liz and the Task Force on the trail of an eco-terrorist with  a mysterious connection to Alexander Kirk, Tom takes matters into his  own hands.

value.name: The Lindquist Concern
value.overview: Liz's loyalties are tested as Red takes action on an operation to  intercept Alexander Kirk. Meanwhile the Task Force races to find a  killer who targets inventors of revolutionary technology.

value.name: The Thrushes
value.overview: When Alexander Kirk contracts a mysterious group that specializes in hacking the world's most secure computer systems, Red and Liz see an opportunity to make a move on Kirk's ..

value.name: Dr. Adrian Shaw (1)
value.overview: Red directs the Task Force to track down an individual who provides new identities to criminals on the run. Meanwhile, as Alexander Kirk's medical condition worsens, Liz seeks guidance from Cooper on a crucial decision.

value.name: Dr. Adrian Shaw: Conclusion (2)
value.overview: Red pressures Dr. Shaw to locate a former patient. Liz contemplates the implications of her ties to an increasingly desperate and dangerous Alexander Kirk. Mr. Kaplan comes to a critical realization about her future.

value.name: Lipet's Seafood Company
value.overview: An investigation into an international terrorist operating on American soil tests the allegiances of the Task Force. As Aram faces the consequences of his girlfriend hacking into the FBI computer systems, Red cashes in on a favor.

value.name: The Forecaster
value.overview: A new case arrives at Liz's doorstep, where someone has left a diorama depicting a crime soon to be committed. Meanwhile, Red explores a new business opportunity.

value.name: The Harem
value.overview: Liz must prove herself to the leader of an elite group of female thieves in order to infiltrate their organization as they prepare for their next heist. Meanwhile, Red contends with unexpected problems in his operations, and Tom channels his energy into fatherly duties.

value.name: Natalie Luca
value.overview: After discovering his criminal empire is under attack, Red turns to the task force for help, leading the team to hunt an assassin who kills her victims by infecting them with a lethal disease. Meanwhile, Red enlists Tom in an undercover operation.

value.name: Isabella Stone
value.overview: As another member of Red's team is targeted, the task force races to stop the sophisticated criminal who has been attacking Red and his businesses. Meanwhile, a shocking event sends Tom on the hunt for information about his past.

value.name: The Architect
value.overview: Aram goes under cover as a hacker to find a criminal who designs and executes crimes for a price.

value.name: The Apothecary
value.overview: After being dosed with poison, Red must retrace his steps to discover which of his closest allies has betrayed him, while the task force races against the clock to find an antidote that will save him.

value.name: Dembe Zuma
value.overview: After weeks of hunting for Dembe, Red and the Task Force finally get a lead on his whereabouts when Aram goes missing. Meanwhile, Dembe takes a calculated risk as Red closes in

value.name: Requiem
value.overview: Memories of the past set Red on a dangerous collision course with an enemy determined to destroy his criminal empire.

value.name: Philomena
value.overview: The Task Force chases an artful bounty hunter employed to target Red's closest associates. Meanwhile, Ressler faces a moral dilemma when he takes on a new assignment with a former colleague.

value.name: Dr. Bogdan Krilov
value.overview: Red sets the Task Force on the trail of a Blacklister with the tools to manipulate memories, causing Liz to question her own experiences. As Gale intensifies his investigation, Ressler receives a new lead on the disappearance of Justice Department official Reven Wright.

value.name: The Debt Collector
value.overview: When Liz becomes the target of a mercenary known as the Debt Collector, Red turns to an unlikely source for help. Meanwhile, Ressler faces an unexpected complication in his efforts to stay ahead of Agent Gale's investigation.

value.name: Mr. Kaplan (1)
value.overview: Mr Kaplan's destruction of Red's empire continues, but Reddington still hopes to be able to reach an agreement with his enemy. Amar is issued a subpoena requiring him to give evidence that could destroy the team and Agent Gale realises how much the Task Force know about Red, and gains a new ally.

value.name: Mr. Kaplan: Conclusion (2)
value.overview: With his empire in tatters, Red makes one last desperate move but Mr. Kaplan may have predicted his play.

value.name: Season 5
value.overview: Feeling surprisingly unencumbered, Raymond Reddington is back, and in the process of rebuilding his criminal empire. His lust for life is ever-present as he lays the foundation for this new enterprise - one that he'll design with Elizabeth Keen by his side. Living with the reality that Red is her father, Liz finds herself torn between her role as an FBI agent and the temptation to act on her more criminal instincts. In a world where the search for Blacklisters has become a family trade, Red will undoubtedly reclaim his moniker as the “Concierge of Crime.”

value.name: Smokey Putnum
value.overview: With his criminal empire in ruins, Red enlists Liz in a plan to earn cash and deliver a new Blacklister to the Task Force.

value.name: Greyson Blaise
value.overview: Liz and the Task Force join Red on an international adventure in pursuit of a billionaire who moonlights as a high end art thief. Meanwhile, Dembe chases a lead and Tom seeks outside help in identifying the remains in the suitcase.

value.name: Miss Rebecca Thrall
value.overview: While the Task Force investigates a series of suspicious police shootings, Agent Ressler is distracted by increasing external pressures. With his back up against the wall, Red drafts Tom in executing an elaborate plan to help re-establish his criminal reputation.

value.name: The Endling
value.overview: Liz and the Task Force hunt for an elusive criminal who will stop at nothing to destroy some of the world's most precious treasures.
